a.g: Exalted is He who took His Servant by night from al-Masjid al-Haram to al-Masjid al-Aqsa, whose surroundings We have blessed, to show him of Our signs. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Seeing.
And We gave Moses the Scripture and made it a guidance for the Children of Israel that you not take other than Me as Disposer of affairs,
O descendants of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah. Indeed, he was a grateful servant.
And We conveyed to the Children of Israel in the Scripture that, "You will surely cause corruption on the earth twice, and you will surely reach [a degree of] great haughtiness.
So when the [time of] promise came for the first of them, We sent against you servants of Ours - those of great military might, and they probed [even] into the homes, and it was a promise fulfilled.
Then We gave back to you a return victory over them. And We reinforced you with wealth and sons and made you more numerous in manpower

[And said], "If you do good, you do good for yourselves; and if you do evil, [you do it] to yourselves." Then when the final promise came, [We sent your enemies] to sadden your faces and to enter the temple in Jerusalem, as they entered it the first time, and to destroy what they had taken over with [total] destruction.

[Then Allah said], "It is expected, [if you repent], that your Lord will have mercy upon you. But if you return [to sin], We will return [to punishment]. And We have made Hell, for the disbelievers, a prison-bed."
Indeed, this Qur'an guides to that which is most suitable and gives good tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds that they will have a great reward.
And that those who do not believe in the Hereafter - We have prepared for them a painful punishment.
And man supplicates for evil as he supplicates for good, and man is ever hasty.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ومن أبوابه العظيمة العجلة وترك التثبت في الأمور وقال صلى الله عليه وسلم العجلة من الشيطان والتأني من الله تعالى وقال عز وجل خلق الإنسان من عجل وقال تعالى وكان الإنسان عجولا وهذا لأن الأعمال ينبغي أن تكون بعد التبصرة والمعرفة والتبصرة تحتاج إلى تأمل وتمهل والعجلة تمنع من ذلك وعند الاستعجال يروج الشيطان شره على الإنسان من حيث لا يدري.
Indeed, from its great gates is haste [al-'ajalah] and abandoning careful consideration in matters. And the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "Haste is from Satan, and deliberation is from God, the Exalted." And the Almighty has said: "Man was created from haste [min 'ajalin]." And He, the Exalted, has said: "And man is ever hasty [‘ajūlan]." This is because actions [al-a'mal] should be after insight [al-tabṣirah] and knowledge [al-ma'rifah], and insight requires contemplation [ta'ammul] and deliberation [tamahhul], and haste prevents that. And during haste, Satan promotes his evil upon man from where he does not perceive.

a.g: And We have made the night and day two signs, and We erased the sign of the night and made the sign of the day visible that you may seek bounty from your Lord and may know the number of years and the account [of time]. And everything We have set out in detail.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
إنما جعل الله الليل والنهار آيتين، فمحا آية الليل وجعل آية النهار مبصرة، لتبتغوا فضلاً من ربكم ولتعلموا عدد السنين والحساب. والفضل المبتغى هو الثواب والمغفرة، إذ المقصود من سير الشمس والقمر بحسبان منظوم مرتب، ومن خلق الظل والنور والنجوم، ليس الاستعانة بها على أمور الدنيا فحسب، بل لتعرف بها مقادير الأوقات فتشتغل فيها بالطاعات والتجارة للدار الآخرة. يدل على ذلك قوله تعالى: ﴿وهو الذي جعل الليل والنهار خلفة لمن أراد أن يذكر أو أراد شكورا﴾، أي يخلف أحدهما الآخر ليتدارك في أحدهما ما فات في الآخر، وبين أن ذلك للذكر والشكر لا غير. فالطريق إلى الله تعالى مراقبة الأوقات وعمارتها بالأوراد على سبيل الدوام، ولذلك قال النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم: (أحب عباد الله إلى الله الذين يراعون الشمس والقمر والأظلة لذكر الله تعالى).
Indeed, Allah has made the night and the day two signs [ayatayn], so He effaced the sign of the night and made the sign of the day seeing, that you may seek bounty [fadl] from your Lord and that you may know the number of years and the calculation. And the bounty sought is the reward [thawab] and the forgiveness [maghfirah], for the purpose of the sun and the moon running by a precise, ordered calculation, and of the creation of the shadow and the light and the stars, is not merely to seek help through them in the affairs of the world [dunya], but rather that you may know by them the measures of the times and occupy yourselves within them with acts of obedience and commerce for the Abode of the Hereafter [al-dar al-akhirah]. This is indicated by His saying, the Most High: "And He is the One Who made the night and the day in succession for whoever desires to remember or desires gratitude," meaning one succeeds the other so that what was missed in one may be made up in the other, and He clarified that this is for remembrance [dhikr] and gratitude [shukr], nothing else. Therefore, the path to Allah, the Most High, is the vigilant observance of times [muraqabat al-awqat] and filling them with regular litanies [awrad] in a manner of constancy, and for that reason the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The most beloved of Allah's servants to Allah are those who observe the sun and the moon and the shadows for the remembrance [dhikr] of Allah, the Most High."

a.g: And [for] every person We have imposed his fate upon his neck, and We will produce for him on the Day of Resurrection a record which he will encounter spread open.
[It will be said], "Read your record. Sufficient is yourself against you this Day as accountant."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وفي هذه القيامة يكون العبد وحده وعندها يقال ﴿ ولقد جئتمونا فرادى كما خلقناكم أول مرة ﴾ {} وفيها يقال ﴿ كفى بنفسك اليوم عليك حسيبا ﴾ {} أما في القيامة الكبرى الجامعة لكافة الخلائق فلا يكون وحده بل ربما يحاسب على ملأ من الخلق وفيها يساق المتقون إلى الجنة والمجرمون إلى النار زمرا لا آحادا والهول الأول هو هول القيامة الصغرى ولجميع أهوال القيامة الكبرى نظير في القيامة الصغرى مثل زلزلة الأرض مثلا فإن أرضك الخاصة بك تزلزل في الموت فإنك تعلم أن الزلزلة إذا نزلت ببلدة صدق أن يقال قد زلزلت أرضهم وإن لم تزلزل البلاد المحيطة بها بل لو زلزل مسكن الإنسان وحده فقد حصلت الزلزلة في حقه لأنه إنما يتضرر عند زلزلة جميع الارض بزلزلة مسكنه لا بزلزلة مسكن غيره فحصته من الزلزلة قد توفرت من غير نقصان.
Indeed, in this [minor] resurrection [qiyamah], the servant ['abd] will be alone, and at that time it will be said: **"And you have certainly come to Us alone as We created you the first time"** (17:14). And in it, it will be said: **"Sufficient is yourself this Day as a reckoner against you"** (17:14). As for the Major Resurrection [al-qiyamah al-kubra] that gathers all of creation, he will not be alone; rather, he may be called to account before an assembly of creation. And in it, the righteous [muttaqun] will be driven to Paradise and the criminals [mujrimun] to the Fire in groups, not as individuals. The first terror [al-hawl al-awwal] is the terror of the minor resurrection [qiyamah sughra], and for all the terrors of the Major Resurrection there is a counterpart in the minor resurrection. Like the quaking of the earth, for example. Indeed, your own specific earth quakes in death. For you know that if a quaking befalls a town, it is truthful to say their earth has quaked, even if the surrounding lands have not quaked. Nay, if a person's dwelling alone quakes, the quaking has occurred in his regard, because he is only harmed by the quaking of the entire earth through the quaking of his own dwelling, not by the quaking of another's dwelling. Thus, his portion [hissah] of the quaking has been fulfilled without any diminishment.

a.g: Whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] his soul. And whoever errs only errs against it. And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. And never would We punish until We sent a messenger.
And when We intend to destroy a city, We command its affluent but they defiantly disobey therein; so the word comes into effect upon it, and We destroy it with [complete] destruction.
And how many have We destroyed from the generations after Noah. And sufficient is your Lord, concerning the sins of His servants, as Acquainted and Seeing.
Whoever should desire the immediate - We hasten for him from it what We will to whom We intend. Then We have made for him Hell, which he will [enter to] burn, censured and banished.
But whoever desires the Hereafter and exerts the effort due to it while he is a believer - it is those whose effort is ever appreciated [by Allah].
To each [category] We extend - to these and to those - from the gift of your Lord. And never has the gift of your Lord been restricted.
Look how We have favored [in provision] some of them over others. But the Hereafter is greater in degrees [of difference] and greater in distinction.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وإنما عرضها من حيث التقدير السموات والأرض، وإذا خرج النظر عن المقدرات فلا نهاية لعرضها، فلا يزال العارف بمطالعتها في جنة عرضها السموات والأرض يرتع في رياضها ويقطف من ثمارها ويكرع من حياضها وهو آمن من انقطاعها، إذ ثمار هذه الجنة غير مقطوعة ولا ممنوعة، ثم هي أبدية سرمدية لا يقطعها الموت، إذ الموت لا يهدم محل معرفة الله تعالى ومحلها الروح الذي هو أمر رباني سماوي، وإنما الموت يغير أحوالها ويقطع شواغلها وعوائقها ويخليها من حبسها فأما أن يعدمها فلا " ولا تحسبن الذين قتلوا في سبيل الله أمواتاً بل أحياء عند ربهم يرزقون فرحين بما آتاهم الله من فضله ويستبشرون بالذين لم يلحقوا بهم من خلفهم " الآية. ولا تظنن أن هذا مخصوص بالمقتول في المعركة فإن للعارف بكل نفس درجة ألف شهيد وفي الخبر " إن الشهيد يتمنى في الآخرة أن يرد إلى الدنيا فيقتل مرة أخرى لعظم ما يراه من ثواب الشهادة وإن الشهداء يتمنون لو كانوا علماء لما يرونه من علو درجة العلماء". فإذن جميع أقطار ملكوت السموات والأرض ميدان العارف يتبوأ منه حيث يشاء من غير حاجة إلى أن يتحرك إليها بجسمه وشخصه، فهو من مطالعة جمال الملكوت في جنة عرضها السموات والأرض، وكل عارف فله مثلها من غير أن يضيق بعضهم على بعض أصلاً، إلا أنهم يتفاوتون في سعة منتزهاتهم بقدر تفاوتهم في اتساع نظرهم وسعة معارفهم، وهم درجات عند الله ولا يدخل في الحصر تفاوت درجاتهم. ولذلك قال تعالى " وللآخرة أكبر درجات وأكبر تفضيلاً ".
Indeed, its expanse [ard] is, in terms of estimation [taqdir], the heavens and the earth. And when the gaze [nazar] transcends the estimations [muqaddarat], there is no end to its expanse. Thus, the knower [al-'arif] in his contemplation [matali'atiha] of it is in a garden [janna] whose expanse [ard] is the heavens and the earth; he roams in its meadows, plucks from its fruits, and drinks from its pools, secure from its cessation, for the fruits of this garden are neither severed nor forbidden. Then, it is eternal [abadiyya], everlasting [sarmadiyya]; death does not cut it off, for death does not demolish the abode [mahall] of the knowledge [ma'rifa] of God, exalted is He, and its abode is the spirit [ruh], which is a divine, heavenly command [amr rabbani samawi]. Rather, death changes its states [ahwal], severs its distractions [shawaghil] and obstacles ['awa'iq], and frees it from its prison. As for annihilating it, no. "And never think of those who have been killed in the way of Allah as dead. Rather, they are alive with their Lord, receiving provision, rejoicing in what Allah has bestowed upon them of His bounty, and they receive good tidings about those [to be martyred] after them who have not yet joined them..." [Quran 3:169-170]. And do not suppose that this is specific to the one killed in battle, for the knower [al-'arif] has, for every breath, the rank [daraja] of a thousand martyrs. And in the report [khabar]: "Indeed, the martyr [shahid] wishes in the Hereafter [al-akhira] to be returned to the world [dunya] to be killed again, due to the greatness of what he sees of the reward for martyrdom [shahada]. And the martyrs wish they had been scholars [ulama] for what they see of the loftiness of the scholars' rank." Therefore, all the regions [aqtar] of the kingdom [mulkut] of the heavens and the earth are the field [meydan] of the knower; he takes his abode therein wherever he wishes, with no need to move to it with his body [jism] and person [shakhs]. Thus, he is, from his contemplation [matala'a] of the beauty [jamal] of the kingdom [mulkut], in a garden [janna] whose expanse [ard] is the heavens and the earth. And every knower [arif] has the like of it, without any of them constricting another in the least. However, they differ in the vastness of their places of delight [munazzahat] according to the extent of their differences in the breadth of their gaze [nazar] and the expanse of their knowledges [ma'arif]. And they are degrees [darajat] with Allah, and the disparity of their degrees cannot be encompassed. And for that reason, He, exalted is He, said: "And the Hereafter [al-akhira] is greater in degrees [darajat] and greater in distinction [tafdilan]."

a.g: Do not make [as equal] with Allah another deity and [thereby] become censured and forsaken.

And your Lord has decreed that you not worship except Him, and to parents, good treatment. Whether one or both of them reach old age [while] with you, say not to them [so much as], "uff," and do not repel them but speak to them a noble word.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقوله عز وجل: ﴿ فلا تقل لهما أفّ ﴾ تعبهما أي بما تحت الظفر من الوسخ وقيل لا تتأذ بهما كما تتأذى بما تحت الظفر.
Indeed, His saying, the Mighty and Majestic: "So do not say to them 'uff' [af]" — it is their exhaustion [ta'bahuma], meaning by that which is beneath the fingernail of filth [wasakh]. And it is said: Do not be harmed by them as you are harmed by that which is beneath the fingernail.

a.g: And lower to them the wing of humility out of mercy and say, "My Lord, have mercy upon them as they brought me up [when I was] small."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
رب اغفر لي ولوالدي وارحمهما كما ربياني صغيرا واغفر للمؤمنين والمؤمنات والمسلمين والمسلمات الأحياء منهم والأموات
Indeed, say: "My Lord [Rabb], forgive me and my parents, and have mercy upon them both, as they raised me when I was small." And say: "And forgive the believing men and the believing women, and the submitting men and the submitting women, the living among them and the dead." This supplication [du'a] is a comprehensive gathering of the rights [huquq] of the servants [ibad]. It begins with the self [nafs], for the one who is not merciful to himself cannot be merciful to others. Then it moves to the parents [walidayn], for their right is the greatest after the right of the Lord [Haqq al-Rabb]. Then it extends to encompass all the believers [mu'minun] and all the Muslims [muslimun], the living [al-ahya'] and the dead [al-amwat], for the community [umma] of Muhammad — peace and blessings be upon him — is a single body [jasad wahid]. The phrase "as they raised me when I was small" is a reminder of the state of utter need [faqr] and weakness [da'f] in childhood, and a prompt to gratitude [shukr] for the blessing [ni'ma] of upbringing [tarbiya]. It is a key [miftah] to the heart [qalb] of mercy [rahma] and a means [wasila] to its descent. And know that the supplication [du'a] for the dead [al-amwat] is a charity [sadaqa] that reaches them, a light [nur] in their graves [qubur], and an expansion [faraj] in their standing [maqam]. For the believer [mu'min] does not cease to benefit [yanfa'u] from the righteous deeds [a'mal saliha] of the living [al-ahya'] after his death [mawt].

a.g: Your Lord is most knowing of what is within yourselves. If you should be righteous [in intention] - then indeed He is ever, to the often returning [to Him], Forgiving.
And give the relative his right, and [also] the poor and the traveler, and do not spend wastefully.
Indeed, the wasteful are brothers of the devils, and ever has Satan been to his Lord ungrateful.
And if you [must] turn away from the needy awaiting mercy from your Lord which you expect, then speak to them a gentle word.
And do not make your hand [as] chained to your neck or extend it completely and [thereby] become blamed and insolvent.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى "ولا تجعل يدك مغلولة إلى عنقك ولا تبسطها كل البسط" والذي يدل على أن المطلوب هو الوسط في الأخلاق دون الطرفين أن السخاء خلق محمود شرعاً، وهو وسط بين طرفي التبذير والتقتير. وقد أثنى الله تعالى عليه فقال "والذين إذا أنفقوا لم يسرفوا ولم يقتروا وكان بين ذلك قواما" وقال تعالى "ولا تجعل يدك مغلولة إلى عنقك ولا تبسطها كل البسط" وكذلك المطلوب في شهوة الطعام الاعتدال دون الشره والجمود قال الله تعالى "وكلوا واشربوا ولا تسرفوا إنه لا يحب المسرفين" وقال في الغضب "أشداء على الكفار رحماء بينهم" وقال ﷺ "خير الأمور أوساطها" وهذا له سر وتحقيق وهو أن السعادة منوطة بسلامة القلب عن عوارض هذا العالم. قال الله تعالى "إلا من أتى الله بقلب سليم" والبخل من عوارض الدنيا، والتبذير أيضاً من عوارض الدنيا، وشرط القلب أن يكون سليماً منهما أي لا يكون ملتفتاً إلى المال ولا يكون حريصاً على إنفاقه ولا على إمساكه، فإن الحريص على الإنفاق مصروف القلب إلى الإنفاق كما أن الحريص على الإمساك مصروف القلب إلى الإمساك فكان كمال القلب أن يصفوا عن الوصفين جميعاً. وإذا لم يكن ذلك في الدنيا طلبنا ما هو الأشبه لعدم الوصفين وأبعد عن الطرفين وهو الوسط، فإن الفاتر لا حار ولا بارد بل هو وسط بينهما فكأنه خال عن الوصفين. فكذلك السخاء بين التبذير والتقتير. والشجاعة بين الجبن والتهور. والعفة بين الشره والجمود. وكذلك سائر الأخلاق فكلا طرفي الأمور ذميم؛ هذا هو المطلوب وهو ممكن.
Indeed, God Almighty has said: "And do not make your hand chained to your neck [mughtalla ilā 'unuqika], nor stretch it out to its utmost extent [lā tabsuthā kulla al-basṭ]." And what indicates that what is sought is the middle course in character traits, not the two extremes, is that generosity [al-sakhā'] is a praiseworthy trait legislatively, and it is a middle course between the two extremes of wastefulness [al-tabdīr] and stinginess [al-taqtīr]. And God Almighty has praised it, saying: "And those who, when they spend, are neither extravagant nor stingy, but maintain a position in between [qawāman]." And God Almighty has said: "And do not make your hand chained to your neck, nor stretch it out to its utmost extent." Likewise, what is sought in the appetite for food is moderation [al-i'tidāl], not gluttony [al-sharah] nor abstinence [al-jumūd]. God Almighty has said: "And eat and drink, and do not be wasteful. Indeed, He does not love the wasteful." And concerning anger, He said: "Severe against the disbelievers, merciful among themselves." And the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "The best of matters are their middle courses." And this has a secret and a verification, which is that felicity [al-sa'āda] is contingent upon the soundness [salāma] of the heart [qalb] from the afflictions [‘awāriḍ] of this world [al-dunyā]. God Almighty has said: "Except he who comes to God with a sound heart [qalb salīm]." And stinginess [al-bukhl] is from the afflictions of the world, and wastefulness [al-tabdīr] is also from the afflictions of the world. And the condition of the heart is that it be sound [salīman] from both of them, meaning it is not turned towards wealth, nor is it eager [ḥarīṣan] to spend it nor to withhold it. For the one eager to spend has his heart diverted [maṣrūf] towards spending, just as the one eager to withhold has his heart diverted towards withholding. So the perfection [kamāl] of the heart is that it be pure [yaṣfū] from both descriptions [al-waṣfayn] together. And if that is not attainable in the world, we seek what is most similar to the absence of the two descriptions and furthest from the two extremes, which is the middle course [al-wasaṭ]. For the lukewarm is neither hot nor cold, but rather a middle course between them, as if it is free from both descriptions. So likewise, generosity [al-sakhā'] is between wastefulness [al-tabdīr] and stinginess [al-taqtīr]. And courage [al-shajā'a] is between cowardice [al-jubn] and recklessness [al-tahawwur]. And chastity [al-'iffa] is between gluttony [al-sharah] and abstinence [al-jumūd]. And likewise all other character traits. So both extremes of matters are blameworthy; this is what is sought, and it is possible.

a.g: Indeed, your Lord extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]. Indeed He is ever, concerning His servants, Acquainted and Seeing.
And do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide for them and for you. Indeed, their killing is ever a great sin.
And do not approach unlawful sexual intercourse. Indeed, it is ever an immorality and is evil as a way.

And do not kill the soul which Allah has forbidden, except by right. And whoever is killed unjustly - We have given his heir authority, but let him not exceed limits in [the matter of] taking life. Indeed, he has been supported [by the law].

And do not approach the property of an orphan, except in the way that is best, until he reaches maturity. And fulfill [every] commitment. Indeed, the commitment is ever [that about which one will be] questioned.
And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with an even balance. That is the best [way] and best in result.
And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed, the hearing, the sight and the heart - about all those [one] will be questioned.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وكل من خاض في شبهه بغير تحقيق فقد خالف قوله تعالى ولا تقف ما ليس لك به علم. وقوله عليه السلام إياكم والظن فإن الظن أكذب الحديث وأراد به ظنا بغير دليل كما يستفتى بعض العوام قلبه فيما أشكل عليه ويتبع ظنه. ولصعوبة هذا الأمر وعظمة كان دعاء الصديق رضى الله تعالى عنه اللهم أرني الحق حقا وارزقنى اتباعه وأرني الباطل باطلا وارزقنى اجتنابه ولا تجعله متشابها على فأتبع الهوى. وقال عيسى عليه السلام الأمور ثلاثة أمر استبان رشده فاتبعه وأمر استبان غيه فاجتنبه وأمر أشكل عليك فكله إلى عالمه. وقد كان من دعاء النبى صلى الله عليه وسلم اللهم إني أعوذ بك أن أقول في الدين بغير علم.
Indeed, whoever delves into matters of doubt without verification has opposed the saying of the Almighty: "And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge [‘ilm]." And His saying, peace be upon him: "Beware of conjecture [zann], for conjecture is the most untruthful of speech." And he intended by this a conjecture without evidence, just as some of the common folk consult their hearts [qulūb] in what is ambiguous to them and follow their conjecture [zann]. And due to the difficulty of this matter and its gravity, the supplication of the Truthful One, may Allah be pleased with him, was: "O Allah, show me the truth as truth and grant me the following of it, and show me falsehood as falsehood and grant me avoidance of it, and do not make it ambiguous to me so that I follow desire [hawā]." And Jesus, peace be upon him, said: "Matters are three: a matter whose soundness has become clear, so follow it; a matter whose misguidance has become clear, so avoid it; and a matter that is ambiguous to you, so refer it to its Knower [‘Ālim]." And from the supplication of the Prophet, prayers and peace of Allah be upon him, was: "O Allah, I seek refuge in You from speaking about the religion without knowledge [‘ilm]."

a.g: And do not walk upon the earth exultantly. Indeed, you will never tear the earth [apart], and you will never reach the mountains in height.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
بيان ذل الاختيال وإظهار آثار الكبر في المشي وجر الثياب قال رسول الله ﷺ "لا ينظر الله إلى رجل يجر إزاره بطراً" وقال ﷺ "بينما رجل يتبختر في بردته إذ أعجبته نفسه فخسف الله به الأرض فهو يتجلجل فيها إلى يوم القيامة" وقال ﷺ "من جر ثوبه خيلاء لا ينظر الله إليه يوم القيامة" وقال ﷺ "من تعظم في نفسه واختال في مشيته لقى الله وهو عليه غضبان". الآثار: عن أبي بكر الهذلي قال: بينما نحن مع الحسن إذ مر علينا ابن الأهثم يريد المقصورة وعليه جباب خز، قد نضد بعضها فوق بعض على ساقه وانفرج عنها قباؤه وهو يمشي يتبختر، إذ نظر إليه الحسن نظرة فقال: أف.. أف.. شامخ بأنفه ثاني عطفه مصعر خده ينظر في عطفيه، أي حميق أنت تنظر في عطفيك في نعم غير مشكورة ولا مذكورة غير المأخوذ بأمر الله فيها ولا المؤدي حتى الله منها، والله أن يمشي أحد طبيعته يتخلج تخلق المجنون في كل عضو من أعضائه لله نعمة، وللشيطان به لفتة، فسمع ابن الأهثم فرجع يعتذر إليه فقال: لا تعتذر إلي وتب إلى ربك، أما سمعت قول الله تعالى "ولا تمش في الأرض مرحاً إنك لن تخرق الأرض ولن تبلغ الجبال طولاً"؟
Indeed, the explanation of that arrogance [ikhityal] and the display of the marks of pride [kibr] in walking and dragging garments. The Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "God will not look at a man who drags his lower garment out of arrogance [batar]." And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "While a man was strutting in his cloak, pleased with himself, God caused the earth to swallow him, and he will be sinking in it until the Day of Resurrection." And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever drags his garment out of arrogance [khayla'], God will not look at him on the Day of Resurrection." And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever shows arrogance [ta'azzama] in himself and walks with arrogance [ikhtala] in his gait will meet God while He is angry with him." The narrations [athar]: From Abu Bakr al-Hadhli, he said: While we were with al-Hasan, Ibn al-Ahtham passed by us heading to the pulpit enclosure, wearing cloaks of silk brocade, layered one over the other on his leg, his robe open from them, and he was walking, strutting. Al-Hasan looked at him a look and said: "Ugh... ugh... holding his nose high, turning his neck, turning his cheek aside, looking at his sides. What a fool you are, looking at your sides in blessings [ni'am] that are unthanked and unremembered, not taken by the command of God concerning them, nor fulfilling what is due to God from them. By God, for one to walk with his natural gait, swaying like the swaying of the insane in every limb of his limbs, is a blessing [ni'mah] from God, and for Satan with him is a temptation." Ibn al-Ahtham heard him and returned to apologize to him. He said: "Do not apologize to me, but repent to your Lord. Have you not heard the saying of God, the Exalted: 'And do not walk upon the earth exultantly [marahan]. Indeed, you will never tear the earth [apart], and you will never reach the mountains in height'?"

a.g: All that - its evil is ever, in the sight of your Lord, detested.
That is from what your Lord has revealed to you, [O Muhammad], of wisdom. And, [O mankind], do not make [as equal] with Allah another deity, lest you be thrown into Hell, blamed and banished.
Then, has your Lord chosen you for [having] sons and taken from among the angels daughters? Indeed, you say a grave saying.
And We have certainly diversified [the contents] in this Qur'an that mankind may be reminded, but it does not increase the disbelievers except in aversion.
Say, [O Muhammad], "If there had been with Him [other] gods, as they say, then they [each] would have sought to the Owner of the Throne a way."
Exalted is He and high above what they say by great sublimity.

The seven heavens and the earth and whatever is in them exalt Him. And there is not a thing except that it exalts [Allah] by His praise, but you do not understand their [way of] exalting. Indeed, He is ever Forbearing and Forgiving.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وَمَا مِنْ ذَرَّةٍ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ إِلَّا وَلَهَا أَنْوَاعٌ شَاهِدَاتٍ لِلَّهِ تَعَالَى بِالْوَحْدَانِيَّةِ هِيَ تَوْحِيدُهَا وَأَنْوَاعٌ شَاهِدَاتٍ لِصَانِعِهَا بِالتَّقْدُسِ هِيَ تَسْبِيحُهَا وَلَكِنْ لَا يَفْقَهُونَ تَسْبِيحَهَا
And there is not a single atom [dharratin] in the heavens and the earth except that it has its own forms [anwa'] which bear witness [shahidatin] for Allah, the Exalted, to His Oneness [al-Wahdaniyyah]; this is its declaration of His Oneness [tawhiduha]. And it has its own forms which bear witness for its Maker to His Holiness [al-Taqdis]; this is its glorification [tasbihuha]. But they do not comprehend its glorification.

a.g: And when you recite the Qur'an, We put between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter a concealed partition.
And We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And when you mention your Lord alone in the Qur'an, they turn back in aversion.
We are most knowing of how they listen to it when they listen to you and [of] when they are in private conversation, when the wrongdoers say, "You follow not but a man affected by magic."
Look how they strike for you comparisons; but they have strayed, so they cannot [find] a way.
And they say, "When we are bones and crumbled particles, will we [truly] be resurrected as a new creation?"
Say, "Be you stones or iron

Or [any] creation of that which is great within your breasts." And they will say, "Who will restore us?" Say, "He who brought you forth the first time." Then they will nod their heads toward you and say, "When is that?" Say, "Perhaps it will be soon -
On the Day He will call you and you will respond with praise of Him and think that you had not remained [in the world] except for a little."
And tell My servants to say that which is best. Indeed, Satan induces [dissension] among them. Indeed Satan is ever, to mankind, a clear enemy.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ومهما انقطع الوفاء بدوام المحبة شمت به الشيطان فإنه لا يحسد متعاونين على بركما يحسد متواخيين في الله ومتحابين فيه فإنه يجهد نفسه لإفساد ما بينهما قال الله تعالى وقل لعبادي يقولوا التي هي أحسن أن الشيطان ينزغ بينهم.
And whenever fidelity [wafa'] is severed by the constancy of love [mahabba], Satan [shaytan] exults over him. For he does not envy two cooperating in righteousness as he envies two who are brothers in God [fi Allah] and who love one another for His sake. Indeed, he exerts himself to corrupt what is between them. God, the Most High, said: "And say to My servants that they should speak that which is best. Indeed, Satan sows discord among them."

a.g: Your Lord is most knowing of you. If He wills, He will have mercy upon you; or if He wills, He will punish you. And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], over them as a manager.
And your Lord is most knowing of whoever is in the heavens and the earth. And We have made some of the prophets exceed others [in various ways], and to David We gave the book [of Psalms].
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وهذه الاختلافات بعضها لاختلاف الأحوال والمقامات وبعضها لما سبق في الأزل من التفاضل والتفاوت في القسمة بين العباد، وقد قال تعالى: " ولقد فضلنا بعض النبيين على بعض "، وقد قال: " منهم من كلم الله ورفع بعضهم درجات " فكان عيسى عليه السلام من المفضلين ولإدلاله سلم على نفسه، فقال: " والسلام علي يوم ولدت ويوم أموت ويوم أبعث حياً" وهذا انبساط منه لما شاهد من اللطف في مقام الأنس.
Indeed, these differences [ikhtilafat] are partly due to the differences in states [ahwal] and stations [maqamat], and partly due to what was preordained in eternity [al-azal] of distinction [tafadul] and disparity [tafawut] in the apportionment [qismah] among the servants [al-'ibad]. And indeed, the Most High has said: "And We have certainly favored some of the prophets over others." And He has said: "Among them are those to whom Allah spoke, and He raised some of them in degrees." Thus, Jesus, peace be upon him, was among the favored ones [al-mufaddalin], and due to his intimate confidence [idlaal], he offered peace upon himself, saying: "And peace be upon me the day I was born, the day I die, and the day I am raised alive." And this is an expansiveness [inbisat] from him for what he witnessed of divine gentleness [al-lutf] in the station of intimate communion [maqam al-uns].

a.g: Say, "Invoke those you have claimed [as gods] besides Him, for they do not possess the [ability for] removal of adversity from you or [for its] transfer [to someone else]."

Those whom they invoke seek means of access to their Lord, [striving as to] which of them would be nearest, and they hope for His mercy and fear His punishment. Indeed, the punishment of your Lord is ever feared.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
إن جميع ما ذكر من الطرق والعبادات هي سبل متعددة إلى الله تعالى، إذ كل يعمل على شاكلته، وربكم أعلم بمن هو أهدى سبيلاً. فكلهم مهتدون، وبعضهم أهدى من بعض، كما في الخبر أن الإيمان ثلاث وثلاثون وثلثمائة طريقة، ومن لقي الله بالشهادة على طريق منها دخل الجنة. وقال بعض العلماء: الإيمان ثلثمائة وثلاثة عشر خلقاً بعدد الرسل، فكل مؤمن على خلق منها فهو سالك الطريق إلى الله. فإذن الناس وإن اختلفت طرقهم في العبادة، فكلهم على الصواب، كما قال تعالى: ﴿أولئك الذين يدعون يبتغون إلى ربهم الوسيلة أيهم أقرب﴾. وإنما يتفاوتون في درجات القرب لا في أصله، وأقربهم إلى الله تعالى أعرفهم به، وأعرفهم به لا بد وأن يكون أعبدهم له، فمن عرفه لم يعبد غيره.
Indeed, all that has been mentioned of the paths [turuq] and acts of worship ['ibadat] are multiple ways [sabīl] to Allah, the Exalted, for each works according to his own disposition, and your Lord is most knowing of who is best guided in way. All of them are guided, and some are more guided than others, as in the report that faith [īmān] is thirty-three and three hundred ways, and whoever meets Allah with the testimony [shahāda] upon one of its ways enters Paradise. And some of the scholars said: Faith is three hundred and thirteen character traits [khuluq] according to the number of the messengers, so every believer upon one of its character traits is a traveler upon the path [ṭarīq] to Allah. Therefore, the people, even if their paths in worship differ, all of them are upon correctness, as Allah, the Exalted, has said: "Those whom they call upon themselves seek a means [wasīla] of approach to their Lord, as to which of them should be the nearest." They only differ in the degrees [darajāt] of nearness [qurb], not in its foundation, and the nearest of them to Allah, the Exalted, is the one most knowing [a'raf] of Him, and the one most knowing of Him must necessarily be the most devout ['abad] to Him, for whoever knows Him does not worship other than Him.

a.g: And there is no city but that We will destroy it before the Day of Resurrection or punish it with a severe punishment. That has ever been in the Register inscribed.

And nothing has prevented Us from sending signs except that the former peoples denied them. And We gave Thamud the she-camel as a visible sign, but they wronged her. And We send not the signs except as a warning.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ومنها الإيجار بالحذف والإضمار كقوله تعالى ﴿ وآتينا ثمود الناقة مبصرة فظلموا بها ﴾ {} معناه آية مبصرة فظلموا أنفسهم بقتلها فالناظر إلى ظاهر العربية يظن أن المراد به أن الناقة كانت مبصرة ولم تكن عمياء ولم يدر أنهم بماذا ظلموا غيرهم أو أنفسهم
Indeed, and among them is the creation [al-ijar] through omission and implication, as in His saying, the Exalted: **"And We gave Thamud the she-camel, a clear sight [mubsirah], but they wronged with it."** Its meaning is: a clear sign [ayatun mubsirah], and they wronged themselves by killing it. So the one who looks at the outward aspect of the Arabic language thinks that what is intended by it is that the she-camel was clear-sighted [mubsirah] and was not blind, and he does not know with what they wronged others or themselves.

a.g: And [remember, O Muhammad], when We told you, "Indeed, your Lord has encompassed the people." And We did not make the sight which We showed you except as a trial for the people, as was the accursed tree [mentioned] in the Qur'an. And We threaten them, but it increases them not except in great transgression.
And [mention] when We said to the angles, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except for Iblees. He said, "Should I prostrate to one You created from clay?"
[Iblees] said, "Do You see this one whom You have honored above me? If You delay me until the Day of Resurrection, I will surely destroy his descendants, except for a few."
[Allah] said, "Go, for whoever of them follows you, indeed Hell will be the recompense of you - an ample recompense.

And incite [to senselessness] whoever you can among them with your voice and assault them with your horses and foot soldiers and become a partner in their wealth and their children and promise them." But Satan does not promise them except delusion.
Indeed, over My [believing] servants there is for you no authority. And sufficient is your Lord as Disposer of affairs.
It is your Lord who drives the ship for you through the sea that you may seek of His bounty. Indeed, He is ever, to you, Merciful.
And when adversity touches you at sea, lost are [all] those you invoke except for Him. But when He delivers you to the land, you turn away [from Him]. And ever is man ungrateful.
Then do you feel secure that [instead] He will not cause a part of the land to swallow you or send against you a storm of stones? Then you would not find for yourselves an advocate.

Or do you feel secure that He will not send you back into the sea another time and send upon you a hurricane of wind and drown you for what you denied? Then you would not find for yourselves against Us an avenger.

And We have certainly honored the children of Adam and carried them on the land and sea and provided for them of the good things and preferred them over much of what We have created, with [definite] preference.

[Mention, O Muhammad], the Day We will call forth every people with their record [of deeds]. Then whoever is given his record in his right hand - those will read their records, and injustice will not be done to them, [even] as much as a thread [inside the date seed].
And whoever is blind in this [life] will be blind in the Hereafter and more astray in way.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ولموازنة البصيرة الباطنة للبصر الظاهر سماه الله تعالى باسمه فقال ما كذب الفؤاد ما رأى سمى إدراك الفؤاد رؤية وكذلك قوله تعالى وكذلك نري إبراهيم ملكوت السموات والأرض وما أراد به الرؤية الظاهرة فإن ذلك غير مخصوص بإبراهيم عليه السلام حتى يعرض في معرض الامتنان ولذلك سمى ضد إدراكه عمى فقال تعالى فإنها لا تعمى الأبصار ولكن تعمى القلوب التي في الصدور وقال تعالى ومن كان في هذه أعمى فهو في الآخرة أعمى وأضل سبيلا
Indeed, to balance the inner insight [al-basirah al-batinah] with the outer sight [al-basr al-zahir], Allah, the Exalted, named it with His name, saying: "The heart [al-fu'ad] did not lie about what it saw [ra'a]." He named the perception [idrak] of the heart [al-fu'ad] as seeing [ru'yah]. And likewise is His saying, the Exalted: "And thus did We show [nuri] Abraham the dominions [malakut] of the heavens and the earth." And what He intended by it was not the apparent seeing [al-ru'yah al-zahirah], for that is not specific to Abraham, peace be upon him, so that it would be presented in the context of a favor. And for that reason, He named the opposite of its perception [idrak] as blindness ['ama], saying, the Exalted: "For indeed, it is not the eyes that become blind [ta'ma], but it is the hearts [al-qulub] within the breasts that become blind [ta'ma]." And He, the Exalted, said: "And whoever is blind ['ama] in this [world], he will be in the Hereafter [al-Akhirah] more blind ['ama] and further astray in way."

a.g: And indeed, they were about to tempt you away from that which We revealed to you in order to [make] you invent about Us something else; and then they would have taken you as a friend.
And if We had not strengthened you, you would have almost inclined to them a little.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وكيف لا تخاف فتنته وقد قيل لسيد المرسلين صلى الله عليه وسلم: (ولولا أن ثبتناك لقد كدت تركن إليهم شيئا قليلا( (الإسراء: 74) وقال أبو سليمان الداراني رحمه الله إذا طلب الرجل الحديث أو تزوج أو سافر في طلب المعاش فقد ركن إلى الدنيا وإنما أراد به طلب الأسانيد العالية أو طلب الحديث الذي لا يحتاج إليه في طلب الآخرة.
And how could you not fear its trial [fitna], when it was said to the Master of the Messengers, peace and blessings be upon him: "And if We had not made you firm [thabbatnāka], you would have almost inclined [tarakana] to them a little" (Al-Isrā': 74). And Abū Sulaymān al-Dārānī, may God have mercy on him, said: If a man seeks a ḥadīth, or marries, or travels in pursuit of livelihood [maʿāsh], then he has inclined [rakana] to the world [dunyā]. And he only meant by this: seeking elevated chains of transmission [al-asānīd al-ʿāliya], or seeking a ḥadīth which is not needed in the pursuit of the Hereafter [al-ākhira].

a.g: Then [if you had], We would have made you taste double [punishment in] life and double [after] death. Then you would not find for yourself against Us a helper.
And indeed, they were about to drive you from the land to evict you therefrom. And then [when they do], they will not remain [there] after you, except for a little.
[That is Our] established way for those We had sent before you of Our messengers; and you will not find in Our way any alteration.
Establish prayer at the decline of the sun [from its meridian] until the darkness of the night and [also] the Qur'an of dawn. Indeed, the recitation of dawn is ever witnessed.
And from [part of] the night, pray with it as additional [worship] for you; it is expected that your Lord will resurrect you to a praised station.
And say, "My Lord, cause me to enter a sound entrance and to exit a sound exit and grant me from Yourself a supporting authority."
And say, "Truth has come, and falsehood has departed. Indeed is falsehood, [by nature], ever bound to depart."
And We send down of the Qur'an that which is healing and mercy for the believers, but it does not increase the wrongdoers except in loss.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
قال تعالى ﴿ هو شفاء ورحمة للمؤمنين ولا يزيد الظالمين إلا خسارا ﴾ {}. وكان مالك بن دينار يقول: ما زرع القرآن في قلوبكم يا أهل القرآن إن القرآن ربيع المؤمن كما أن الغيث ربيع الأرض. وقال قتادة: لم يجالس أحد هذا القرآن إلا قام بزيادة أو نقصان قال تعالى ﴿ هو شفاء ورحمة للمؤمنين ولا يزيد الظالمين إلا خسارا ﴾ {}.
Indeed, He, the Most High, says: "It is a healing [shifa'] and a mercy [rahma] for the believers, and it increases the wrongdoers [zalimun] in nothing but loss [khusran]." And Malik ibn Dinar used to say: "What has the Quran planted in your hearts [qulub], O people of the Quran? For indeed, the Quran is the springtime [rabi'] of the believer, just as the rain is the springtime of the earth." And Qatadah said: "No one sits with this Quran except that he rises with an increase or a decrease." He, the Most High, says: "It is a healing [shifa'] and a mercy [rahma] for the believers, and it increases the wrongdoers [zalimun] in nothing but loss [khusran]."

a.g: And when We bestow favor upon the disbeliever, he turns away and distances himself; and when evil touches him, he is ever despairing.
Say, "Each works according to his manner, but your Lord is most knowing of who is best guided in way."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
إن جميع الطرق المذكورة هي سبل إلى الله تعالى، إذ قال الله عز وجل: ﴿ قل كل يعمل على شاكلته فربكم أعلم بمن هو أهدى سبيلا ﴾، فكل العاملين مهتدون، وبعضهم أهدى من بعض، كما في الخبر أن الإيمان ثلاث وثلاثون وثلثمائة طريقة، ومن لقي الله بالشهادة على طريق منها دخل الجنة. وقال بعض العلماء إن الإيمان ثلثمائة وثلاثة عشر خلقاً بعدد الرسل، فكل مؤمن على خلق منها فهو سالك الطريق إلى الله. فالناس وإن اختلفت طرقهم في العبادة، فكلهم على الصواب، كما قال تعالى: ﴿ أولئك الذين يدعون يبتغون إلى ربهم الوسيلة أيهم أقرب ﴾، وإنما يتفاوتون في درجات القرب لا في أصله، وأقربهم إلى الله تعالى أعرفهم به، وأعرفهم به لا بد وأن يكون أعبدهم له، فمن عرفه لم يعبد غيره.
Indeed, all the mentioned paths are ways to God [Allah] the Exalted, for God [Allah] the Mighty and Majestic has said: "Say, 'Each works according to his manner [shakilatihi], but your Lord is most knowing of who is best guided in way [sabilan].'" Thus, all who act are guided, and some of them are more guided than others, as in the report that faith [iman] is three hundred and thirty-three ways, and whoever meets God [Allah] bearing witness [shahada] upon one of them enters Paradise. And some of the scholars have said that faith [iman] is three hundred and thirteen character traits [akhlaq], equal to the number of the messengers, so every believer upon one of those traits is a traveler upon the path [tariq] to God [Allah]. So the people, even if their paths [turuq] in worship differ, they are all upon correctness, as the Exalted has said: "Those whom they call upon seek a means [wasila] to their Lord—which of them shall be nearer." They only differ in degrees of nearness [qurb], not in its foundation, and the nearest of them to God [Allah] the Exalted is the most knowing of Him, and the most knowing of Him must necessarily be the most devout in worship to Him, for whoever knows Him does not worship other than Him.

a.g: And they ask you, [O Muhammad], about the soul. Say, "The soul is of the affair of my Lord. And mankind have not been given of knowledge except a little."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فسبحان من عرف عباده ما عرف ثم خاطب جميعهم فقال وما أوتيتم من العلم إلا قليلا فهذا بيان معاقد الجمل التى تجول فيها فكر المتفكرين فى خلق الله تعالى وليس فيها فكر فى ذات الله تعالى ولكن يستفاد من الفكر فى الخلق لا محالة معرفة الخالق وعظمته وجلاله وقدرته وكلما استكثرت من معرفة عجيب صنع الله تعالى كانت معرفتك بجلاله وعظمته أتم وهذا كما أنك تعظم عالما بسبب معرفتك بعلمه فلا تزال تطلع على غريبه من تصنيفه أو شعره فتزداد به معرفة وتزداد بحسنه له توقيرا وتعظيما واحتراما حتى إن كل كلمة من كلماته وكل بيت عجيب من أبيات شعره يزيده محلا من قلبك يستدعى التعظيم له فى نفسك فهكذا تأمل فى خلق الله تعالى وتصنيفه وتأليفه وكل ما فى الوجود من خلق الله وتصنيفه والنظر والفكر فيه لا يتناهى أبدا وإنما لكل عبد منها بقدر ما رزق فلنقتصر على ما ذكرناه ولنضف إلى هذا ما فصلناه فى كتاب الشكر فإنا نظرنا فى ذلك الكتاب فى فعل الله تعالى من حيث هو إحسان إلينا وإنعام علينا وفى هذا الكتاب نظرنا فيه من حيث إنه فعل الله فقط وكل ما نظرنا فيه فإن الطبيعي ينظر فيه ويكون نظره سبب ضلاله وشقاوته والموفق ينظر فيه فيكون سبب هدايته وسعادته وما من ذرة فى السماء والأرض إلا والله سبحانه وتعالى يضل بها من يشاء ويهدي بها من يشاء فمن نظر فى هذه الأمور من حيث إنها فعل الله تعالى وصنعه استفاد منه المعرفة بجلال الله تعالى وعظمته واهتدى به ومن نظر فيها قاصرا للنظر عليها من حيث تأثير بعضها فى بعض لا من حيث ارتباطها بمسبب الأسباب فقد شقى وارتدى فنعوذ بالله من الضلال ونسأله أن يجنبنا مزلة أقدام الجهال بمنه وكرمه وفضله وجوده ورحمته
Glory be to the One who made known to His servants what He made known, then addressed them all, saying: *"And you have not been given of knowledge except a little."* This is the clarification of the pivotal points upon which the thoughts of those who contemplate the creation of God, Exalted is He, revolve. And there is in it no contemplation of the Essence [dhat] of God, Exalted is He. But from the contemplation of creation is inevitably gained knowledge [ma'rifa] of the Creator, and His majesty, and His grandeur, and His power. And whenever you increase in knowledge of the wondrous making [sana'] of God, Exalted is He, your knowledge of His grandeur and His majesty becomes more complete. This is just as you hold a scholar in awe due to your knowledge of his knowledge. You do not cease to discover the marvels of his composition or his poetry, so you increase thereby in knowledge, and you increase thereby in reverence, awe, and respect for him, to the point that every word of his words and every wondrous line of his poetry increases his station in your heart [qalb], calling forth awe for him within your soul [nafs]. Thus, contemplate the creation of God, Exalted is He, and His composition and His arrangement, and all that exists of the creation [khalq] of God and His making [tasnif]. And the gazing and the contemplation in it is never-ending. But for every servant [abd] of it is only a portion of what he has been granted. So let us limit ourselves to what we have mentioned, and let us add to this what we have detailed in the Book of Gratitude. For we looked in that book at the act of God, Exalted is He, from the perspective of it being a beneficence to us and a favor upon us. And in this book, we look at it from the perspective that it is solely the act of God. And all that we look upon in it—the naturalist looks upon it and his looking becomes a cause of his misguidance and wretchedness, and the one granted success looks upon it and it becomes a cause of his guidance and his felicity. And there is not a single particle in the heaven and the earth except that God, Glorified and Exalted is He, misguides by it whom He wills and guides by it whom He wills. So whoever looks upon these matters from the perspective that they are the act [fi'l] of God, Exalted is He, and His making [sana'], gains from it knowledge of the majesty of God, Exalted is He, and His grandeur, and is guided by it. And whoever looks upon them, limiting his gaze to them from the perspective of the effect of some of them upon others, and not from the perspective of their connection to the Causer of Causes, has indeed become wretched and has donned the garment of misguidance. So we seek refuge with God from misguidance, and we ask Him to keep us from the stumbling places of the feet of the ignorant, by His grace and His generosity and His bounty and His giving and His mercy.

a.g: And if We willed, We could surely do away with that which We revealed to you. Then you would not find for yourself concerning it an advocate against Us.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وكذلك الصوفية فقد كان الشبلي في مسجده ليلة من رمضان وهو يصلي خلف إمام له فقرأ الإمام ولئن شئنا لنذهبن بالذي أوحينا إليك فزعق الشبلي زعقة ظن الناس أنه قد طارت روحه واحمر وجهه وارتعدت فرائصه وكان يقول بمثل هذا يخاطب الأحباب يردد ذلك مرارا
And likewise the Sufis [as-Sufiyyah], indeed, al-Shibli was in his mosque one night of Ramadan, and he was praying behind an imam of his. So the imam recited: "And if We willed, We could surely take away that which We have revealed to you..." (17:86). Then al-Shibli let out a cry [za'qah]—the people thought his soul [ruh] had flown away—and his face reddened, and his limbs trembled. And he was saying, "With words like this are the beloved ones [al-ahbab] addressed!" He kept repeating that many times.

a.g: Except [We have left it with you] as a mercy from your Lord. Indeed, His favor upon you has ever been great.
Say, "If mankind and the jinn gathered in order to produce the like of this Qur'an, they could not produce the like of it, even if they were to each other assistants."
And We have certainly diversified for the people in this Qur'an from every [kind] of example, but most of the people refused [anything] except disbelief.
And they say, "We will not believe you until you break open for us from the ground a spring.
Or [until] you have a garden of palm tress and grapes and make rivers gush forth within them in force [and abundance]
Or you make the heaven fall upon us in fragments as you have claimed or you bring Allah and the angels before [us]

Or you have a house of gold or you ascend into the sky. And [even then], we will not believe in your ascension until you bring down to us a book we may read." Say, "Exalted is my Lord! Was I ever but a human messenger?"
And what prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them except that they said, "Has Allah sent a human messenger?"
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
الله تعالى الكفار به أعني الحسد بالعداوة... السبب الرابع: التعجب، كما أخبر الله تعالى عن الأمم السالفة إذ قالوا "ما أنتم إلا بشر مثلنا" "وقالوا أنؤمن لبشرين مثلنا" "ولئن أطعتم بشراً مثلكم إنكم إذاً لخاسرون" فتعجبوا من أن يفوز برتبة الرسالة والوحي والقرب من الله تعالى بشر مثلهم فحسدوهم، وأحبوا زوال النبوة عنهم جزعاً أن يفضل عليهم من هو مثلهم في الخلقة، لا عن قصد تكبر وطلب رياسة وتقدم عداوة أو سبب آخر من سائر الأسباب، وقالوا متعجبين "أبعث الله بشراً رسولاً" وقالوا "لولا أنزل علينا الملائكة" وقال تعالى "أو عجبتم أن جاءكم ذكر من ربكم على رجل منكم" الآية.
Indeed, the disbelievers in Him—I mean, envy [al-hasad] through enmity... The fourth cause: Astonishment [ta'ajjub], just as God the Exalted informed about the nations of old when they said, "You are but human beings like us," and "They said, 'Shall we believe for two human beings like ourselves?'" and "And if you obey a human being like yourselves, then indeed you would be losers." So they were astonished that a human being like them should attain the rank of Messengership and Revelation and proximity to God the Exalted, and thus they envied them, and desired the removal of Prophethood from them, out of distress that one who is like them in creation should be favored over them—not from an intention of arrogance and seeking leadership and precedence of enmity, or another cause from among the other causes. And they said, astonished, "Has God sent a human being as a messenger?" and they said, "Why were angels not sent down to us?" and God the Exalted said, "Or do you wonder that a Reminder from your Lord should come to you upon a man from among you?"—the verse.

a.g: Say, "If there were upon the earth angels walking securely, We would have sent down to them from the heaven an angel [as a] messenger."
Say, "Sufficient is Allah as Witness between me and you. Indeed he is ever, concerning His servants, Acquainted and Seeing."

And whoever Allah guides - he is the [rightly] guided; and whoever He sends astray - you will never find for them protectors besides Him, and We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection [fallen] on their faces - blind, dumb and deaf. Their refuge is Hell; every time it subsides We increase them in blazing fire.
That is their recompense because they disbelieved in Our verses and said, "When we are bones and crumbled particles, will we [truly] be resurrected [in] a new creation?"

Do they not see that Allah, who created the heavens and earth, is [the one] Able to create the likes of them? And He has appointed for them a term, about which there is no doubt. But the wrongdoers refuse [anything] except disbelief.
Say [to them], "If you possessed the depositories of the mercy of my Lord, then you would withhold out of fear of spending." And ever has man been stingy.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال قل لأيوب: ﴿ قل لو أنتم تملكون خزائن رحمة ربي إذا لأمسكتم خشية الإنفاق ﴾ {}
Say, "Indeed, if you possessed the treasuries of my Lord's mercy [khaza'in rahmati rabbi], you would surely withhold them, fearing expenditure [khashiyata al-infaq]."

a.g: And We had certainly given Moses nine evident signs, so ask the Children of Israel [about] when he came to them and Pharaoh said to him, "Indeed I think, O Moses, that you are affected by magic."
[Moses] said, "You have already known that none has sent down these [signs] except the Lord of the heavens and the earth as evidence, and indeed I think, O Pharaoh, that you are destroyed."
So he intended to drive them from the land, but We drowned him and those with him all together.
And We said after Pharaoh to the Children of Israel, "Dwell in the land, and when there comes the promise of the Hereafter, We will bring you forth in [one] gathering."
And with the truth We have sent the Qur'an down, and with the truth it has descended. And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.
And [it is] a Qur'an which We have separated [by intervals] that you might recite it to the people over a prolonged period. And We have sent it down progressively.
Say, "Believe in it or do not believe. Indeed, those who were given knowledge before it - when it is recited to them, they fall upon their faces in prostration,
And they say, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, the promise of our Lord has been fulfilled."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فقال: لا إله إلا الله سبحان الله "إن كان وعد ربنا لمفعولا"
Indeed, there is no god but God [Allah], glory be to God [Subhan Allah]. "If the promise of our Lord is to be fulfilled."

a.g: And they fall upon their faces weeping, and the Qur'an increases them in humble submission.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وكل ذلك ثناء على الخوف لأن مذمة الشيء ثناء على ضده الذي ينفيه وضد الخوف الأمن كما أن ضد الرجاء اليأس وكما دلت مذمة القنوط على فضيلة الرجاء فكذلك تدل مذمة الأمن على فضيلة الخوف المضاد له بل نقول كل ما ورد في فضل الرجاء فهو دليل على فضل الخوف لأنهما متلازمان فإن كل من رجا محبوبا فلابد وأن يخاف فوته فإن كان لا يخاف فوته فهو إذا لا يحبه فلا يكون بانتظاره راجيا فالخوف والرجاء متلازمان يستحيل انفكاك أحدهما عن الآخر نعم يجوز أن يغلب أحدهما على الآخر وهما مجتمعان ويجوز أن يشتغل القلب بأحدهما ولا يلتفت إلى الآخر في الحال لغفلته عنه وهذا لأن من شرط الرجاء الخوف تعلقهما بما هو مشكوك فيه إذ المعلوم لا يرجى ولا يخاف فإذن المحبوب الذي يجوز وجوده يجوز عدمه لا محالة فتقدير وجوده يروح القلب وهو الرجاء وتقدير عدمه يوجع القلب وهو الخوف والتقدير أن يتقابلان لا محالة إذا كان ذلك الأمر المنتظر مشكوكا فيه نعم أحد طرفي الشك قد يترجح على الآخر بحضور بعض الأسباب ويسمى ذلك ظنا فيكون ذلك سبب غلبة أحدهما على الآخر فإذا غلب على الظن وجود المحبوب قوى الرجاء وخفي الخوف بالإضافة إليه وكذا بالعكس وعلى كل حال فهما متلازمان ولذلك قال تعالى: ﴿ ويدعوننا رغبا ورهبا ﴾ وقال عز وجلّ: ﴿ يدعون ربهم خوفا وطمعا ﴾ ولذلك عبر العرب عن الخوف بالرجاء فقال تعالى: ﴿ ما لكم لا ترجون لله وقارا ﴾ أي لا تخافون وكثيرا ما ورد في القرآن الرجاء بمعنى الخوف وذلك لتلازمهما إذ عادة العرب التعبير عن الشيء بما يلازمه بل أقول كل ما ورد في فضل البكاء من خشية الله فهو إظهار لفضيلة الخشية فإن البكاء ثمرة الخشية فقد قال تعالى: ﴿ فليضحكوا قليلا وليبكوا كثيرا ﴾ وقال تعالى: ﴿ يبكون ويزيدهم خشوعا ﴾.
Indeed, all of that is praise for fear [khawf], for to censure a thing is to praise its opposite which negates it. And the opposite of fear [khawf] is security [amn], just as the opposite of hope [raja'] is despair [yā's]. And just as the censure of despair [qunut] indicates the virtue of hope [raja'], so too does the censure of security [amn] indicate the virtue of the fear [khawf] that opposes it. Rather, I say: Everything that has come regarding the virtue of hope [raja'] is evidence for the virtue of fear [khawf], for they are inseparable [mutalaziman]. For everyone who hopes [yarju] for a beloved [mahbub] must necessarily fear [yakhaf] missing it. If he does not fear [yakhaf] missing it, then he does not love it, and thus he is not hoping [raji] in anticipation of it. Therefore, fear [khawf] and hope [raja'] are inseparable [mutalaziman]; it is impossible for one to be detached from the other. Yes, it is possible for one of them to dominate the other while they are both present, and it is possible for the heart [qalb] to be occupied with one and not turn to the other in a given moment due to heedlessness [ghaflah] of it. This is because a condition of hope [raja'] is fear [khawf]; their connection is to that which is uncertain [mashkuk fih], for what is known [ma'lum] is neither hoped [yurja] for nor feared [yukhaf]. Therefore, the beloved [mahbub] whose existence is possible, its non-existence is also inevitably possible. So, envisioning its existence comforts the heart [qalb], and that is hope [raja']; and envisioning its non-existence pains the heart [qalb], and that is fear [khawf]. And it is inevitable that these two estimations confront each other when that awaited matter is uncertain [mashkuk fih]. Yes, one side of the doubt [shakk] may become preponderant over the other due to the presence of some causes, and that is called assumption [zann], and that becomes a cause for the dominance of one over the other. So, if the assumption [zann] of the beloved's [mahbub] existence dominates, hope [raja'] is strengthened and fear [khawf] becomes hidden relative to it, and likewise the opposite. In any case, they are inseparable [mutalaziman]. And for that reason, the Exalted said: "And they supplicate to Us in eager desire [raghban] and fear [rahaban]" [Qur'an 21:90]. And the Almighty said: "They supplicate to their Lord in fear [khawfan] and hope [tama'an]" [Qur'an 32:16]. And for that reason, the Arabs expressed fear [khawf] as hope [raja']. The Exalted said: "What is [wrong] with you that you do not hope [tarjuna] for Allah grandeur [waqar]?" [Qur'an 71:13] – meaning, you do not fear [takhafuna]. And often in the Qur'an, hope [raja'] has come with the meaning of fear [khawf], due to their inseparability [talazum], for it is the habit of the Arabs to express a thing by what accompanies it. Rather, I say: Everything that has come regarding the virtue of weeping from awe [khashyah] of Allah is a manifestation of the virtue of awe [khashyah], for weeping is the fruit of awe [khashyah]. Indeed, the Exalted said: "So let them laugh a little and weep much" [Qur'an 9:82]. And the Exalted said: "They weep, and it increases them in humility [khushu'an]" [Qur'an 17:109].

a.g: Say, "Call upon Allah or call upon the Most Merciful. Whichever [name] you call - to Him belong the best names." And do not recite [too] loudly in your prayer or [too] quietly but seek between that an [intermediate] way.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
حديث عائشة في قوله تعالى ولا تجهر بصلاتك ولا تخافت بها أي بدعائك متفق عليه.
Indeed, the narration of Aisha regarding His saying, the Most High: "And do not raise your voice in your prayer [salat] nor be silent with it" — meaning, with your supplication [du'a'] — is agreed upon.

a.g: And say, "Praise to Allah, who has not taken a son and has had no partner in [His] dominion and has no [need of a] protector out of weakness; and glorify Him with [great] glorification."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
الحمد لله الذي لم يتخذ ولدا، فإن الحمد لله هو الثناء على الله تعالى بما يستحقه من صفات الكمال، وترك اتخاذ الولد يدل على تنزيهه عن النقص والاحتياج، إذ الولد إنما يتخذ لحاجة أو لاستكمال، والله تعالى غني عن العالمين، فحمد نفسه على ذلك بيان لتفرده بالألوهية وبراءته من الشركاء، ففي هذا تذكير للمؤمن بأن يخلص في حمده لله، ويستحضر معاني التوحيد في كل ذكر ودعاء، كالكلمات العشر التي توقظ القلب وتنوع الذكر لئلا يمل، فتكون القراءة والذكر وسيلة لتحقيق هذا الحمد الخالص.
Indeed, all praise [al-hamd] is for Allah who has not taken a son. For all praise [al-hamd] for Allah is the extolling of Allah, exalted is He, with what He deserves of attributes of perfection [sifat al-kamal], and the refraining from taking a son indicates His transcendence [tanzih] above deficiency and need. For a son is only taken out of need or for completion, and Allah, exalted is He, is rich [ghani] beyond all worlds. So His praising Himself for that is a clarification of His uniqueness in divinity [uluhiyya] and His freedom from partners. In this is a reminder for the believer that he must be sincere [ikhlas] in his praise of Allah, and that he must bring to mind the meanings of divine oneness [tawhid] in every remembrance [dhikr] and supplication, like the ten words that awaken the heart [qalb] and diversify the remembrance [dhikr] so that it does not grow weary, so that recitation and remembrance become a means to realize this pure praise [hamd khalis].
